alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Laurel, northeastern Pulaski, western Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bee Lick, or 10 miles west of Mount Vernon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ottowa, Indian Lakes Park, Quail and Willailla around 450 PM EDT. Spiro, Gum Sulphur, Bromo, Wabp and Level Green around 455 PM EDT. Lake Linville, Maretburg, Hiatt, Sand Springs and Hansford around 500 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Vernon, Muellersville, Renfro Valley, Wildie, Burr, Roundstone, Wellhope, Conway, Snider, Hummel, Dudley Station, Orlando, Flat Rock, Bummer, Withers, Sinks, Pine Hill, Disputanta, Sand Hill, Cooksburg, Johnetta, Robinet, Goochland, Donaro, Jep Hill, Loam, Threelinks, Climax and Horse Lick. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 53 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
